Author: Boing7898
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Market orders do affect the auction price. Evermerket choose the volume-maximizing price (using the last price in case of a tie), and market orders can affect what price this would be.

Author: tarolog
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Any reason for choosing Ethereum? Maybe, better other blockchain? Maybe own blockchain? This is interesting question.

Author: kusumadewi
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: public blockchain can be slow and expensive. Block inclusion times for on-chain activities on large networks like Ethereum are measured in tens of seconds, rather than microseconds like on prominent futures exchanges. Issuing orders on the public blockchain would also create significant transactions costs and change the paradigm, as most futures exchanges charge only per trade, not per order. Due to these challenges, was decided to forego the traditional limit order book and will instead utilize periodically settled pro-rata call auctions. Since devs cannot enforce price-time priority, they advocate price-size priority instead; orders are filled in proportion to their volume on a price level, or pro rata. An important benefit of this is that it deemphasizes speed; you can still compete even if you aren’t the fastest.

Author: termion
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Devs see several issues with the current futures marketplace, namely unfair pricing, aggressive HFT algos taking advantage of retail and institutions, and difficulty accessing different markets globally for international traders Devs are trying to solve for those issues.  Also on EverMarkets, devs'll allow traders to use crypto as collateral, giving crypto traders a way to access traditional and crypto markets without leaving the crypto ecosystem.

Block inclusion times for on-chain activities on large networks like Ethereum are measured in tens of seconds, rather than microseconds like on prominent futures exchanges. Issuing orders on the public blockchain would also create significant transactions costs and change the paradigm, as most futures exchanges charge only per trade, not per order. Due to these challenges, developers have decided to forego the traditional limit order book and will instead utilize periodically settled pro-rata call auctions. Since they cannot enforce price-time priority, they advocate price-size priority instead; orders are filled in proportion to their volume on a price level, or pro rata. An important benefit of this is that it deemphasizes speed; you can still compete even if you aren’t the fastest.

Author: cryptohype
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: First of all, I personally read the whitepaper of Evermarket, watched almost all interview- (videos) of your company / CEO Jim and read some articles. Having checked on your team members I believe you will execute your vision and offer real value for the crypto space by bridging it with derivatives (future trading) as a first-mover. However, when EMX is listed and available for everyone to buy, you cannot decide who is allowed to buy in and in what amount since it will be open for the whole public. As a consequent, there will always be mixed kind of personalities in the community. So it will be on your head to stop “fud” (if it happens). And the best way to stop fud and have a good community is to have an amazing and useful product. If your product is really good, even if dump happens, most people will still support you and your company will steadily rise in value. But if your product does not exceed or meet the expectation, the community will turn bad and as a consequent you will lose the support. So, I think your finished product is the deciding factor to have a supportive and good community.

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Update: We've been very busy.  Since our initial announcement we've been meeting with many interested pre-sale purchasers and potential investors, and refining our project based on their suggestions.  Please drop us an email if you'd like to chat as well.  We've been working through a few legal items, and as mentioned, will be pushing back our public sale to accommodate.  With a mission of democratizing global financial exchanges, our project is fairly complex on the legal and regulatory side, and we've decided to be extra cautious to better serve our platform and its participants in the long run.  We hope to announce public token sale dates and terms in the near future.  We now have a private demo which we've started to show potential purchasers and investors.  It can conduct auctions, incorporate collateral, and record trading on the Rinkeby Testnet (Ethereum).  There's still some work to do before we can open it for the general public, but if you'd like a private demo we can try to address personally if you send us an email.  We have added a new head technologist and star developer to our project, Craig Austin.  He comes to us with 7 years of experience from the $195 Billion hedge fund AQR, where he led a team of 18 developers as Head of the Asset Allocation research engineering team.  His official start date is in October, but he idles in our slack chat.  He previously spent 5 years as a software developer at Microsoft, and went to Carnegie Mellon with many members of our team.  We have also added a new advisor, Jerald David, who has 20 years of experience in the commodities and finance space.  Jerry was previously Director of Venture Management at the CME Group, and Chief Marketing Officer at the Dubai Mercantile Exchange.  He is extremely familiar with the exchanges landscape, and will also be kickstarting our marketing efforts.  We will be launching our blog very soon, and as mentioned, will be starting our public marketing efforts.  We currently don't have much of a presence outside of bitcointalk, but that will be changing.  Stay tuned, and thanks for following!

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: As an update, we've brought on a few additional people onto our team:  Mark Pimentel, who is joining as Head of Trading, has 10+ years of algorithmic trading experience from giants like Citadel Investment Group and Knight Capital Group.  He is an expert in price prediction signals and market microstructure, and will be a pivotal part of our liquidity provision efforts.  Mark attended Carnegie Mellon with Jim & Craig; they've all known each other ~15 years.  Evan Rothmayer is an experienced developer and will be working on systems and infrastructure.  He worked previously with Craig and Eric at Microsoft and Amazon, and is a great asset for our team.

Author: tinyteapot
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: I like the project idea and i sincerely wish you a success but i am more afraid than been in doubt about the S&P stocks implementations because this requires a lot of funds and government regulations.  what legal backing are you putting in place to secure investors funds because US government can just wake up one morning and sue you % your team for one financial crime or the other.  Which regulated body do you have?

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: tinyteapot,  Yes, our platform is ambitious and will be subject to regulatory concerns, both domestic (US) and abroad.  Our budgeting takes into account extensive legal costs, including in-house counsel from individuals well versed in the futures space.  We are not taking the regulatory environment lightly, but believe that there is a path forward fully compliant with all laws.  As to the security of funds, since we are building a decentralized system, we hold no funds ourselves.  Your funds will be locked up in smart contracts with predetermined liquidation conditions, and upon the termination of a trade, all proceeds are delivered directly back to originating wallets.  More importantly, in this way the system will actually be more secure than traditional brokerages since the accountability of funds can be tracked 100%.  All "customer accounts" are completely transparent.

Author: yua_na
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: i will watch this, btw how you manage the liquidity ?

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Hi yua_na,  We have a lot of market making experience on our team, with individuals having written both market making strategies and dark pools.  As part of our liquidity plan, we are building a liquidity provision team which will take the other side of imbalances.  If there are more buyers than sellers, for example, we will try to step in as a seller.  We will calibrate our models such that we maximize volume.  We will manage this risk through a combination of liquidation on live continuous exchanges (such as a NASDAQ or CME), holding risk until subsequent auctions, and hedging with other correlated instruments.  Thanks,

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: All contracts will clear on the blockchain.  We are not affiliated with existing exchanges, and can even envision offering more contracts than they do in the future.

Author: wavelengthsf
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Are you settling these as OTC then? Are you mapping back to the legacy options with things like delivery points and contract sizes? Will pricing be tied to legacy options?  Lets say I want to buy a call on crude for Sept '17 @ 4750.0. CME has it at $2.80 (for example) - do you imagine your contract would trade at a different price than that?  Since these other exchanges have such a large portion of the liquidity on commodities options, does all your internal liquidity come from your quant desk?

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Expiry prices will be set by oracles, which are tied to existing exchanges or other real-world data sources (at least in the short-medium term).  Most non- expiry trades will be free to execute at wherever price such that volume is maximized.  Ideally this would be at or near the midpoint of existing exchanges.  You can think of our platform as an alternate source for futures liquidity.  We will have an internal quant desk to help supply liquidity, yes, but envision third-party traders (more like arbitrageurs) assisting as well.  We will also solicit external parties to provide liquidity on our platform.  The latter part of this strategy can be a relationships game, so we will need experienced sales people to help in this.  We have a few in mind who are interested in joining after a successful token sale (they haven't joined yet).  A few members of our team have experience creating dark pools, and have been involved in creating some of the biggest in the world.  We've done this before, albeit in equities.  To that end, we are aiming to be transparent in execution.  We intend to having competitive spreads relative to CME (if we didn't, we wouldn't be able to host a ton of liquidity).

Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Hi No.14,  We really wanted to make this a free service too, but realized it would not be possible.  At a minimum, we would need transaction fees to record trades on the blockchain.  For any extra services, like offering leverage, we'd need to compensate lenders as well (as you would now to, say, a broker).  If fees are a given, we decided that the best way to ensure that these costs are manageable and competitive is to make them a market in and of themselves.  That's what we're looking to do: any service, such as offering leverage or maintain markets, should have low barriers to entry and low switching costs.  They should be as transparent as possible.  That's how you protect against monopoly pricing power.  That's how you keep fees low.  And that's the kind of platform we're building.  Happy to answer any further comments.

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: EMX (EverMarkets Exchange) The future of derivatives trading web: www.emx.com telegram: t.me/evermarkets  Imagine using your crypto holdings to trade gold, the Yuan or the S&P 500. EMX gives crypto holders the ability to trade global futures contracts on a single platform--all without the need to convert to fiat. Built by a veteran team of traders, technologists and exchange operators, EMX bridges the crypto and traditional markets to deliver an unparalleled experience.  About the market The global futures market has revenues of $20B+, trillions in underlying notional, and is ripe for innovation.   Existing exchanges have high fees, can be difficult to access, and skew markets with price discrimination. Futures volumes have been increasing for the last ten years -- with Asia leading growth -- but there is a dearth of competition.  About our team We are technologists and traders from with 10+ years experience each from companies like Amazon, Microsoft, CME Group, and Citi. Our advisors have built the largest equity dark pools in the world and are managers of notable futures funds. We are not a fly-by-night operation, but are in this for the long haul.  Platform Features Access to more assets: Trade crypto and traditional futures, including commodities, equities and currencies. More opportunities: Don't just buy, sell or hold--go long or short, trade pairs and indexes, or access leverage. With EMX, there's no such thing as a "bear market." Crypto in, crypto out: Build a diversified portfolio without ever having to exchange into fiat. With the EMX Token, there's no need to switch between tokens or currencies. Efficient trading: Through the usage of smart contracts, transactions are cleared and settled in just seconds. Secure and transparent: There's no central custody of assets or information, minimizing the risk of theft, downtime, and trading errors. A fair structure, for everyone: EMX creates a level playing field for everyone, using a periodic, auction based matching model to eliminate unfair speed advantages.  Read more in our whitepaper: https://www.emx.com/assets/whitepaper-en.pdf  How we're different The main difference between us and Augur, Gnosis, and other predictive markets is that we are emphasizing liquidity. We are also different from current exchanges like Bitmex and OKex in that we have a hybrid exchange model, and we're also offering traditional asset classes (like commodities and equities) on top of cryptocurrency futures. We also have many connections in the finance world, and will bring these parties as external liquidity providers onto our platform. In short, we believe we have the team needed to drive significant volume onto this platform from the real world.  Our token sale Our public token sale is tentatively scheduled for Q3 2018.  Final terms will be announced in coming weeks. There is a private presale. Please email jim@emx.com for more information.  Why this is a great opportunity Our team is experienced and poised to shake up the global financial markets. We are targeting futures first, but will also look into stocks, options, fx, and more. In short, our long term plan is to revolutionize every equity and derivative exchange in the world. This is a big opportunity.  We're just beginning to build our community and are interested in hearing your comments and suggestions.

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Someone from the forum emailed and asked about our trading mechanics, so I did a short write up in our FAQ for all to see: https://evermarkets.com/faq/#section-whyauctions.  Basically, instead of continuous order book trading, we will be utilizing periodic pro-rata call auctions instead.  We believe this mechanic will be a significant innovation in the futures space.  In fact, we've spoken to many futures traders in our research, and there's been very strong demand for liquidity and execution alternatives.  (If you have other questions, please feel free to PM, email, or reply.  If it's a common enough question we'll just put something up on the FAQ.  Thanks)

Author: evermarkets
Title: EMX | Trade Futures on Stocks, Bonds, Commodities
Body: Hi Adykingcity, thanks for your comment.  Things were a little hectic yesterday since we just announced the project publicly for the first time.  I hope you'll understand.  We had a few investors reach out to us about seed funding, and we've been very close to bringing on board two new team members with valuable skills whom we've been talking with for a while.  That being said, we're going to announce the bounties soon -- most likely within 48 hours.  We're going to have bounties for marketing on different forms of media.  We're going to have translation bounties for 6-10 of the top languages.  I'm meeting with our marketing director Justin later today to hash things out.  We were going to wait on our announcement post until we had all the bounty details straightened out, but my friend-- who's a Staff member at this forum-- was around yesterday to help so we just decided to post then.  Thanks for your patience!  I can PM you too when we announce if you like.
